clauses.clause: It looked strangely deserted
I was very surprised to find that none of the boys were there
Although I was extremely lonely and unhappy at this time
I felt sure they would laugh at me and especially at the sign I was forced to wear
But one day Mr Mell told me that the headmaster
had returned
and wanted to see me .
Ye-es
I said
although I was a little worried that all my money would disappear
When we went upstairs to bed
When we were all too tired to stay awake
Goodnight
putting a hand on my head
i 'll take care of you  .   It s very kind of you
You haven t got a sister
However
even with the Murdstones there
seemed a much more pleasant place than school
I was a little surprised to find that my mother had a new baby
However
even with the Murdstones there
seemed a much more pleasant place than school
I was a little surprised to find that my mother had a new baby
My stepfather and his sister seemed to hate me even more than before
In fact
As the cart drove away
smiling sadly at me .
I knew the truth
Your mother is dead
I was already sobbing loudly and I felt I was an orphan
Mrs Creakle packed my case herself
So next morning Mr Barkis appeared at the door with his cart
We climbed up and sat beside him
Peggotty was naturally a little sad to leave her old home
But when Mr Barkis saw her drying her eyes and looking more cheerful
Barkis is willing ! You told her that !  Aloud he said to Peggotty
youll always be welcome to come and stay ! So when I returned to Blunderstone
At home
All the warehouse workers were coarse
who were used to working in dirty conditions for long hours
No words can describe the horror I felt
I was deeply ashamed at having such a job and I was also afraid that I would forget everything I had learnt from my mother and my teachers .
All the warehouse workers were coarse
who were used to working in dirty conditions for long hours
No words can describe the horror I felt
I was deeply ashamed at having such a job and I was also afraid that I would forget everything I had learnt from my mother and my teachers .
All the warehouse workers were coarse
who were used to working in dirty conditions for long hours
No words can describe the horror I felt
I was deeply ashamed at having such a job and I was also afraid that I would forget everything I had learnt from my mother and my teachers .
He stayed in prison for several weeks
I gave the news to Mrs Micawber when I returned home
I knew I would never see him
Now I had lost everything I owned in the world
But one day my aunt suggested that I should go to boarding school in Canterbury  .  I was delighted
He stared at me for a moment  .  Then he cried
they 've put you in number 44 ? i 'll soon change that  .  And when Steer forth complained to the manager
When I knocked at the door
What a lovely girl ! And what a coarse young man she 's engaged to ! I was shocked by these unexpectedly cold words  .  But when I turned to him and saw him smiling
When Mrs Micawber came in
In a few moments they had both dried their eyes and looked quite cheerful again  .  I realized that the Micawbers had not changed at all
I slept in the streets or in the woods  and I could do what I wanted  when I wanted  .  It was a fine life

clauses.emotion_token: I didnt like it at all
clauses.clause: So  I went back  and the widow cried and I had to put on those new clothes again  I didnt like it at all
Her sister  Miss Watson  lived there too  .   She was always saying  dont put your feet there Huckleberry and dont do that  Huckleberry  It was terrible
Of course  the next morning Miss Watson was angry with me because of my dirty clothes  but the widow just looked unhappy
I went to school most of the time and I was learning to read and write a little  It wasnt too bad  and the widow was pleased with me
I often sat talking to Jim  butI still didnt like living in a house and sleeping in a bed
But when Pop had money   he got drunk again and made trouble in town  He was always coming to the widow 's house  and she got angry and told him to stay away
